(THIS DOCUMENT IS THE PEflJ&KPY Off HIS BglgAMIO MJKSTY1S &OVE1UTONT.)SECBE T. Copy No. Q0,1,-370. 0 A B I I E I,ADMINISTRATION OF THE WATERWAYS OF THE STRAITS AMD THE o&i OF IkRMORA.copy of a letter from Mr. Lloyd George to Marshal foch.(Circulated fordnformation with reference to CP.-864)L 0 O 0 H,16th March, 1920.M. le Marechal,In continuation of my letter of yesterdayTs date enclosing copies of the Rejort of the Committee on the Administration of the Waterways of the Straits and the b4a of Marmora, I have the honour to inform yon that it was further agreed by the Council of Ambassadors and Foreign Ministers that Article 27 of the above Report should be adopted so far as the Council were concerned, subject to reference to the Joint fiaval and Military Commission, of which you are Chairman.I have the honour to request that when considering Articles 22 to 6, Article 27 may also be considered in the light of the decision of the Council expressed above. 'I have the honour to be M. le Mareohal, Your obedient Servant,(Sd.) D, Lloyd Oeorge.M. le Marechal FOCH. EXTRACT FROM REPORT OF THE COMMITTEE ON THE ADMINISTRATION OF THE WATERWAYS OF THE STRAITS AND THE SEA OF MARMORA.
27. Nothing in Articles 23, 24, 25 and 26 shall be deemed as limiting the powers of a belligerent or belligerents acting in pursuance of a decision by the Council of the league of Nations.
